text: so when i think back over the year and i
think of the favorite moment
uh there are always a bunch of things
that come to mind we actually had two
babies born
during the course of the semester and
students in my class and
one i thought i got married over one of
the weekends in the middle of the
semester
i think my favorite moment was when saul
khan
attended our class on khan academy and
entrepreneurial finance
members of our community were very
directly affected
by the boston marathon bombings
but then i saw the way in which everyone
mobilized rallied together in order to
support
everyone and it's been one of the most
inspiring
moments of my time at hbs challenges
they face is how to be a leader
how to take charge of events that are
impossible to get your arms around
how to deal with ambiguity how to deal
with uncertainty
and how to lead with integrity our
students are primed
to think broadly innovatively
and to always try to make a difference
in the world i think they're ready
and i think they'll do it try to do
something that you
care about intensely that you try to do
it to the absolute best of your ability
and that you recognize that you have to
help
those that come behind you just like
those that came before you helped you
but do something you care about
passionately and everything will take
care of itself
there has to be a group of men and women
who look beyond partisan politics
trying to find a villain but
really trying to find the saints in
society
and the kinds of people who can work
together
and make a difference to everybody
i'd like to congratulate this graduating
class
and wish you good luck but i also
wish you a long and healthy and
productive life
